page.title: 12ORSETT CONTAINER BASE DEPOT.
page.content: This was originally an Army camp.With the advent of containers it was to be used as a depot for containers passing through Tilbury Dock.The containers were to be unpacked and packed here.This carried on for a short while but industrial disputes as to who should pack and unpack the containers caused dock strikes at Tilbury.Dockers maintained that they should be the only ones to pack and unpack the containers,within 5 miles of Tilbury Docks.The depot closed down as a result of this and most of the traffic transferred to a depot at Barking,some 12-15 miles away.The depot is now used as an overnight stop for containers.It is also used as a fumigation centre for containers,to prevent the spread of germs and disease from country to country to conform with hygiene regulations.
